required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Wald Outreach for Wellness: Blood Pressure Outreach

brief_summary.textblock: The Wald Outreach Center will partner with Medicine for the Greater Good (MGG) to implement this pilot project called Wald Outreach for Wellness (WOW), a blood pressure outreach wellness intervention in a retail setting.

detailed_description.textblock:
WOW aims to provide community members with a digital blood pressure monitor, health education, and health care navigation as practical strategies to improve community members' management of pre-hypertension, and to reduce associated burdens and risks related to hypertension health disparities.
This approach to reaching populations who use retail settings has the potential to implement a health promotion and wellness strategy aimed at populations with increased risk for hypertension related health disparities. The outreach strategy is aimed at reaching community members where community members gather for health care, provide the community members with practical, low-cost strategies for promoting health and wellness, increase community members' knowledge in hypertension management, help the community members navigate health care options and get the community members engaged in a medical home thereby reducing the burdens of hypertension health disparities.
This research is important to continue to assess the best ways to reach and reduce hypertension health disparities in underserved communities with limited access to health care.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in actions to control hypertension as assessed by the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System Module 7
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline, 6 weeks and 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Change in yes/no answers assessed by Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS) Module 7. 10 questions graded by yes/no response.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline and every 2 weeks, up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Change in blood pressure (BP) measured in mmHg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in usage of BP monitor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline and every 2 weeks, up to 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in usage of blood pressure monitor assessed by number of BP readings done by participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in knowledge of the signs and symptoms of a heart attack and stroke as assessed by BRFSS Module 8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline, 6 weeks and 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Change in knowledge (yes/no responses) of signs and symptoms of stroke/heart attack as assessed by BRFSS Module 8. 13 Questions graded by yes/no.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in engagement with healthcare provider as assessed by BRFSS Section 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline, 6 weeks and 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Change in engagement with healthcare provider/medical home as assessed by BRFSS Section 3. 3 questions graded by yes/no.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive blood pressure monitor and health passport to record blood pressure readings for 3 months. Participants will receive daily text message reminders to take and record blood pressure readings. Participants will receive health education and health care navigation. Participants will be assessed for social determinants of health. Participants will take surveys 3 times over 3 months. Participants will receive home visits or phone calls to collect data and receive health coaching.

intervention.description: Health education and coaching, health care navigation,

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Community residents who participate in Day at the Market
- Adult individuals 18 years and older whose recorded BP reading is within the pre-hypertensive range 120-139 systolic; 80-89 diastolic
- Able to read and understand English
Exclusion Criteria:
- 17 years or younger
- BP reading above pre-hypertensive range
- Unable to read and understand English

overall_official.affiliation: Johns Hopkins University School of Nursing

facility.name: Johns Hopkins University School of Nursing
